creatures.name: Alghoul
creatures.description: Alghouls are a sub-species of necrophage, and the biological cousins of ghouls, distinguished by their darker visage, larger size and strength, colourings, and intelligence.

creatures.name: Graveir
creatures.description: Graveirs are a species of necrophage, and the cousins of ghouls. Unlike their smaller cousins, these creatures can be distinguished by the three bony combs on their skull, blunt claws, strong teeth and a long tongue for feeding on marrow.

creatures.name: Devourer
creatures.description: Devourer, or Black Annis, are said to derive from a tale of Baba Yaga where a man happened upon a devourer. If so, a disclaimer is required: the tale was softened. It provides only a faint idea of what can happen to a stray traveler who should have the misfortune of passing near a devourer's lair.

creatures.name: Cemetaur
creatures.description: The most powerful of all the necrophages, the Cemetaur is the true queen of the necropolis. A Graved Dead spells certain death to anyone but a witcher. This is a well-known fact among grave robbers and all who live near battlefields.
